text.p: Victrex Plc said on Monday that it expects pretax profit for the six months ending March 31, 1997 is likely to be below the the same period of 1996.
It said in a statement that it expected the downturn because of continued adverse effects of currency movements plus indications of a slower January.
Victrex made pretax profits of 6.26 million stg for the six months to March 31, 1996.
However, Victrex said it expects a stronger performance in the second half than in the second half of the year ending September 1996.
By 0832 GMT, shares in the company had lost 68-1/2p to stand at 197-1/2p.
